results.title: Effect of valsartan versus lisinopril on peritoneal sclerosis in rats.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Forty-three non-@<m>DISEASE_Hemolytic_Uremic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006463 @@@uremic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were divided into four groups: group I (Sham) @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ received no treatment (n=11), group II received hypertonic (3.86%, 10 ml/day) PD solution (n = 10) and groups III and IV received hypertonic PD solution (10 ml/day) plus 640 mg/L @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@ (n=11) and 100 mg/L @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in drinking water (n = 11).

citations.NLM: Duman S, Sen S, Duman C, Oreopoulos DG. Effect of valsartan versus lisinopril on peritoneal sclerosis in rats. Int J Artif Organs. 2005 Feb;28(2):156-63. PMID: 15770604
citations.BibTeX: @article{15770604, title={Effect of valsartan versus lisinopril on peritoneal sclerosis in rats.}, author={Duman S and Sen S and Duman C and Oreopoulos DG}, journal={Int J Artif Organs}, volume={28}, number={2}, pages={156-63}}

results.title: The influence of ACE-inhibition on myocardial mass and diastolic function in chronic hemodialysis patients with adequate control of blood pressure.
results.text_hl: The objectives of this study were to evaluate the specific effect of the @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@-inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on myocardial mass and diastolic function in @<m>DISEASE_Hemolytic_Uremic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006463 @@@uremic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ using a protocol designed to leave blood pressure unchanged.

citations.NLM: Roithinger FX, Punzengruber C, Wallner M, Ulbrich W, Pachinger O, Kramar R, Prischl FC. The influence of ACE-inhibition on myocardial mass and diastolic function in chronic hemodialysis patients with adequate control of blood pressure. Clin Nephrol. 1994 Nov;42(5):309-14. PMID: 7851032
citations.BibTeX: @article{7851032, title={The influence of ACE-inhibition on myocardial mass and diastolic function in chronic hemodialysis patients with adequate control of blood pressure.}, author={Roithinger FX and Punzengruber C and Wallner M and Ulbrich W and Pachinger O and Kramar R and Prischl FC}, journal={Clin Nephrol}, volume={42}, number={5}, pages={309-14}}

results.title: Hypotensive reaction during staphylococcal protein A column therapy in a patient with anomalous degradation of bradykinin and Des-Arg9-bradykinin after contact activation.
results.text_hl: CASE REPORT: A @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Mitomycin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D016685 @@@mitomycin@@@-associated @<m>DISEASE_Hemolytic_Uremic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006463 @@@hemolytic-uremic syndrome@@@ received SPA treatments after her ACE inhibitor, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, was held.

citations.NLM: Molinaro G, Adam A, Lepage Y, Hammerschmidt D, Koenigbauer U, Eastlund T. Hypotensive reaction during staphylococcal protein A column therapy in a patient with anomalous degradation of bradykinin and Des-Arg9-bradykinin after contact activation. Transfusion. 2002 Nov;42(11):1458-65. PMID: 12421219
